summary: This bill, the Real Education and Access for Healthy Youth Act of 2025, aims to improve young people's health and well-being by expanding access to comprehensive sex education and sexual health services. It authorizes grants for schools, higher education institutions, and youth-serving organizations. The bill emphasizes evidence-informed, inclusive, and culturally responsive programs, addressing inequities faced by underserved youth. It also provides for educator training, requires reporting and evaluation, and repeals the abstinence-only until marriage program, directing funds toward its goals.
